Package controller

Class ScheduleScreenController

java.lang.Object
controller.ScheduleScreenController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class ScheduleScreenController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Author:
Hamza Yousaf Controller for the "SchedulerDashboard" view, Manages the display of appointments in various reports and navigation through the application.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initializes the scheduler dashboard, loading appointment data and preparing combo boxes for reporting.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - The URL for initialization
      resourceBundle - The resource bundle for initialization

    • populateTable

      public void populateTable()
      Populates the main appointment table and sets up table columns. Visibility of other tables is adjusted for clear display.

    • populateTableMonth

      public void populateTableMonth()
      Loads and displays appointments for the current month as per the user's system time zone. This method queries the database for appointments corresponding to the current month. It also sets up the table columns using the TableColumns interface and a lambda expression, streamlining the process of initializing table columns. The method additionally manages the visibility of this and other TableView elements to ensure that only the relevant table is displayed at any given time.

    • populateTableWeek

      public void populateTableWeek()
      Populates the TableView with appointments scheduled for the current day and the upcoming seven days, based on the user's local time zone. This method performs a database query to fetch appointments falling within the next week. It initializes the TableColumns, streamlining this process by using the TableColumns interface with a lambda expression for efficiency. The method also manages the visibility of various TableView elements, ensuring only relevant data is displayed while hiding others.

    • toCustomerGUI

      public void toCustomerGUI(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Navigates to the customer dashboard.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event triggered by button click.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • AddAppointment

      public void AddAppointment(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method brings the user to the AddAppointment view.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The action when the button is clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • UpdateAppointment

      public void UpdateAppointment(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException, SQLException
      Transitions the user to the UpdateAppointment view. This method first checks if an appointment has been selected from the TableView. If no selection is made, it displays an error alert. Upon selecting an appointment, it loads the UpdateAppointment view and pre-populates the fields with the selected appointment's data.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event triggered when the button is clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException
      SQLException

    • deleteAppointment

      public void deleteAppointment() throws SQLException
      Removes the selected appointment from the database. Initially checks if an appointment is selected in the TableView. If no selection is made, an error alert is displayed. Upon selection, the user is prompted to confirm the deletion. After confirmation, the appointment is deleted and a success message is shown. The TableView is then refreshed to reflect the changes.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • getTypeMonthReport

      public void getTypeMonthReport() throws SQLException
      Generates and displays a report based on type and month. Ensures correct table visibility.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If SQL database access fails

    • getContactReport

      public void getContactReport() throws SQLException
      Displays the contact-based report in the reportContactTable. This method executes when a user selects a contact from the combo box and retrieves the corresponding appointment data. If no contact is selected, it prompts the user with an error alert. The method initializes the necessary TableColumns and ensures only the relevant reportContactTable is visible. Additionally, it deselects the view radio buttons to allow for a fresh selection and view reset of the appointment TableView.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • getCustomReport

      public void getCustomReport() throws SQLException
      Displays a customized report in the reportCustomTable based on the user's location selection. The method queries and shows results according to the chosen location from the combo box. If no location is selected, the user is notified with an alert. This method also initializes the necessary TableColumns for the report and manages the visibility of various TableView elements to display only the reportCustomTable. Additionally, it resets the View radio buttons for a fresh selection in the appointment TableView.
      Throws:
      SQLException
